location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 9: Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: This letter primarily concerns Ephraim Gerrish Stannus's attempts to establish what became of the remains of a cargo of indigo, which was shipped from Calcutta in 1812 and reportedly seized at Bushire by Jaffir Khan [Muhammad Ja'far Khan]. In addition, Stannus states that a number of jewels belonging to the estate of Mahomed Nebbee Khan [Muhammad Nabi Khan, former Governor of Bushire] have been valued by some of the principal merchants at Bushire. This letter is followed by a list, dated 24 December 1823, which states the value of the aforementioned jewels.
